mechanoreception.notes: As starfish, Freyellidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for detecting water currents and substrate vibrations, aiding in prey detection and navigation in the deep sea.

chemoreception.notes: Likely use chemoreceptors to detect chemical cues in the water, aiding in food localization in the deep sea environment.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of functional eyes is unknown in Freyellidae. Deep-sea environments have reduced light, but some deep-sea animals possess bioluminescence sensitivity.
